intro: Disporum tonkinense, commonly known as the Tonkin disporum, is a member of the Colchicaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its clustered, grass-like foliage and distinctive floral structures. Native to Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam and China, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are typically arranged in umbels. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
